alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Marengo; Perry; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 3:41PM CDT until August 24 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Greene, Hale, Marengo, Perry and Sumter. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 PM CDT, Minor flooding may be occurring due to earlier heavy rainfall. Heavy rain has now moved east of the advisory area, but minor flooding may persist for a few more hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Demopolis, Livingston, Eutaw, York, Linden, Uniontown, Cuba, Jefferson, Forkland, Thomaston, Boligee, Sweet Water, Gainesville, Epes, Myrtlewood, Faunsdale, Emelle, Dayton, Dug Hill and Coatopa.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
